_meanings:
A particle often used with
nouns to form Karmadhāraya and
Bahuvrīhi compounds, and with
adjectives and adverbs. It has the
following senses:

{@--3@} Well, perfectly, thoroughly,
properly; {#sujIrRamannaM suvicakzaRaH sutaH#}
{#suSAsitA strI nfpatiH susevitaH#} &c…  
{#sudIrGakAle'pi na yAti vikriyAM#} <ls>H. 1. 22.</ls>

{@--4@} Easily, readily, as in {#sukara#} or
{#sulaBa#} <ab>q. v.</ab>
having a happy end, ending well.

{1} one whose deeds are righteous,
virtuous, good.

one who has acquired a great 
reputation for liberality in giving and
using (money &c.).

{1} the
double jasmine. 
{2} the plantain.
{3} the great-flowered jasmine.

{1} any good or
virtuous act, kindness, favour,
service; {#nAdatte kasyacitpApaM#} 
{#kasyacitsukftaM viBuH#} <ls>Bg. 5. 15</ls>, <ls>Me. 17.</ls>

an enclosure
round a place of sacrifice to exclude
profane access.

having
a beautiful house or abode, 
welllodged; {#sugfhI nirgfMhIkftA#} <ls>Pt. 1. 390.</ls>

{2} used or applied 
properly or auspiciously.

{1}
one whose name is auspiciously 
invoked, one whose name it is 
auspicious to utter (as Bali, 
Yudhishṭhira), a term used as a 
respectful mode of speaking;  
{#sugfhItanAmnaH BawwagopAlasya pOtraH#} <ls>Māl. 1.</ls>

{4} <ab>N.</ab> of one of the four 

horses of Kṛṣṇa.

{7} <ab>N.</ab> of a 
monkeychief and brother of Vāli. [By the
advice of Kabandha Rāma went to
Sugrīva who told him how his 
brother had treated him and besought
his assistance in recovering his wife,
promising at the same time that he
would assist Rāma in recovering his
wife Sītā. Rāma, therefore, killed
Vāli, and installed Sugrīva on the
throne. He then assisted Rāma with
his hosts of monkeys in 
conquering Rāvaṇa, and recovering Sītā.].

{1} a 
discerning or wise man, learned man.

a well-conducted, devoted,
and virtuous wife.

deep thought, deep
reflection or consideration.
for a very long time, very long.
a pair of nippers or tongs.

{1} a good
or virtuous man, benevolent man.

{2} extremely delicate or slender,
very thin.

{2} the foundation of a
large building.

{2} liberal or
rich in sacrificial gifts; <ls>Pt. 1. 310.</ls>

<ab>N.</ab> of the wife of Dilīpa;
{#tasya dAkziRyarUQena nAmnA magaDavaMSajA .#}
{#patnI sudakziRetyAsIt#} <ls>R. 1. 31</ls>, <ls n="R.">3. 1</ls>

the female elephant
of the north-west quarter.

the discus of Viṣṇu;
as in {#kfzRopyasudarSanaH#} <ls>K.</ls>

{5} <ab>N.</ab> of
a very poor Brāhmaṇa who came
to Dvārakā with only a small 
quantity of parched rice as a present
to his friend Kṛṣṇa, and was 
raised by him to wealth and glory.

{2} a special gift given on 
particular solemn occasions.

{3} one who
offers such a gift.

{2} a fine
day or weather (<ab>opp.</ab> {#durdina#}); so
{#sudinAhaM#} in the same sense.

very distant
or remote. ({#sudUraM#} means {1} to a
great distance. {2} to a very high
degree, very much. {#sudUrAt#} ‘from
afar, from a distance’).

the council or 
assembly of gods.

{1} the hall
or palace of Indra.

{2} one
diligent in properly maintaining
his family.

having a good understanding, wise,
clever, intelligent.

a wise
or intelligent man, learned man or
{%pandit%}.

a good 
understanding, good sense, intelligence.

{1} a particular kind of royal
palace.

one of the seven tongues
of fire.

{2} having a
good nave or centre.

{%<ab>ind.</ab>%} very secretly or
closely, very narrowly, privately.

{1} good
conduct, good manners, propriety.
{2} good policy. 
{3} <ab>N.</ab> of
the mother of Dhruva, <ab>q. v.</ab>

a woman
having a good husband.

{2} a class of bird-like beings
of a semi-divine character.

well-jointed, having many
joints or knots.

{4} a special lunar day (as the day
of full or new moon, and the 8th
and 14th day of each fortnight).

{1} a good or suitable vessel,
worthy receptacle.

{2} a fit or 
competent person, any one well-fitted
for an office, an able person.

{2} <ab>N.</ab> of the
son of Sampāti, elder brother of
Jaṭāyu.

a woman
having a good husband.

{1}
well blossomed, being in full flower.

{2} having the hair thrilling or 
bristling.

{3} of the 
elephant of the north-east quarter.

one of
the seven tongues of fire.

{1} an auspicious dawn or day-break;
{#dizwyA supraBAtamadya yadayaM devo wwazwaH#} <ls>U. 6</ls>

(in prosody) a
foot of two short syllables.

{1} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva.
{2} <ab>N.</ab> of the father of Śakuni.

<ab>N.</ab> of a demon, brother of
Mārīca, who had become a demon
by the curse of Agastya. He with
Mārīca began to disturb the 
sacrifice of Viśvāmitra, but was 
defeated by Rāma and Lakṣmaṇa;
see <ls>R. 11. 29.</ls>

{2} <ab>N.</ab> of
one of the sixteen priests employed
at a sacrifice.

{1} very 
fortunate or prosperous, happy, blessed.
highly favoured.

a
woman beloved by her husband, a
favourite wife.
the son of a favourite wife.

<ab>N.</ab> of the sister of
Balarāma and Kṛṣṇa, married to
Arjuna <ab>q. v.</ab> She bore to him a
son named Abhimanyu.

{2}
abundance of food, an abundant
supply of provisions, plenty of corn
&c.

a 
lovely woman. ({%<ab>N. B.</ab>%} The vocative
singular of this word is strictly
{#suBrUH#}; but {#suBru#} is used by writers
like Bhaṭṭi, Kālidāsa, and 
Bhavabhūti; {#hA pitaH kvAsi he suBru#}
<ls>Bk. 6. 17</ls>; so <ls>V. 3. 22</ls>;  
<ls>Ku. 5. 43</ls>; <ls>Māl. 3. 8.</ls>)

{1} a good mind or disposition,
kindness, benevolence, friendship.

{6} <ab>N.</ab> of the wife
of Sagara and mother of 60,000
sons.

a very sweet or gentle speech,
agreeable words.

{1} good-minded, of a good 
disposition, benevolent.

_gram:
, {%<ab>n.</ab>%}; said to be <ab>pl.</ab> only
by some

_meanings:
{1} <ab>N.</ab> of one
of the wives of Daśaratha and
mother of Lakṣmaṇa and Śatrughna

having a good 
understanding, wise, intelligent.

{3} a
hole cut in a house ({#suraMgA#} also in
this sense).

{2} a chaplet, garland
for the head.

governed by a good king; {#surAjYi#}
{#deSe rAjanvAn#} <ls>Ak.</ls>

<ab>N.</ab> of a country
on the western side of India (Surat).

one of
the seven tongues of fire.

{2} the day of full moon in
the month of Chaitra, or a festival
celebrated in honour of Kāmadeva
in that month (also {#suvasaMtakaH#} in this
sense).

{1} a 
woman married or single who resides
in her father's house.

{2} a married
woman whose husband is alive.

an 
attendant on the women's apartments
(wrongly for {#sOvidalla#} q. v).

strict in the observance of religious
vows, strictly religious or virtuous.

{2} a tractable cow,
one easily milked.

{2} <ab>N.</ab> of one of the
eight favourite wives of Kṛṣṇa.

<ab>N.</ab> of the
author of a system of medicine,
whose work, together with that
of Caraka, is regarded as the 
olddest medical authority, and held
in great esteem in India even to
this day.

{1} well-suited, 
being in a good sense.

{3} in good or
or prosperous circumstances, 
prosperous.

a woman
with a pleased or smiling 
countenance.

one of
the seven tongues of fire.

having a kind heart, cordial, 
friendly, loving, affectionate.
